name: Name
generate_credential_step1_title_descript: To connect securely to Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka, your application or tool needs an API key with permission to access the Kafka instance and resources such as topics.
credential_aplication_reason_form_label: What do you want your application to do?
generate_credential_step2_title_descript: Choose which topics the credential can access
credential_rule_popover_data: This control is not functional for this prototype.
generate_credential_step3_title_descript: Choose which consumer groups the credential can access
generate_credential_step4_title_descript: Choose which transaction IDs the credential can access
clientid_empty_state_body: Use this client ID to connect with the Kafka instance. Copy the client ID and secret and keep in a safe place. This is the only time the client ID and secret will display.
client_id_confirmation_checkbox_label: I have copied the client ID and secret
drawer_resource_tab_body_description_1: To connect an application or tool to this Kafka instance, you will need the address of a Kafka listener, and generated credentials.
drawer_resource_tab_body_description_2: Your application or tool will make its initial connection to the Kafka instance using the bootstrap server, and authenticate with credentials specific to the server if required.
drawer_resource_tab_body_description_3: Applications and tools that use the REST producer API will need the REST producer endpoint to connect.
